parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To cry aloud, shriek. A primary verb; properly, to 'croak' or scream, i.e. to call aloud.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: (primarily physical), I look, see, perceive, discern. A primary verb; to look at.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A burning, trial, fiery test. From puroo; ignition, i.e., smelting.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Feminine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: (a) I say, speak; I mean, mention, tell, (b) I call, name, especially in the pass., (c) I tell, command.

parse: Interrogative / Indefinite Pronoun - Nominative Feminine Singular
str2: Who, which, what, why. Probably emphatic of tis; an interrogative pronoun, who, which or what.
Like, similar to, resembling, of equal rank. From the base of homou; similar.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Large, great, in the widest sense.
A city, the inhabitants of a city. Probably from the same as polemos, or perhaps from polus; a town.
